title: How to Make Chakalaka

steps.headline: Place the saucepan on the stovetop.
steps.description: Add the oil and heat over medium heat.

steps.headline: Add the chopped onion, grated carrot, diced chilies and minced garlic.
steps.description: Tip in the curry powder. Cook for 5 minutes until the onion turns soft. Stir often to prevent it from sticking and burning.

steps.headline: Add the tomatoes.
steps.description: Stir through the mixture and bring to the boil. Once it boils, reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the baked beans.
steps.description: Stir to mix in. Taste test before adding salt and pepper to season the dish.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Transfer to 2 bowls or plates. Serve warm with pap, crusty bread or couscous, polenta or rice.

steps.headline: Place the large saucepan or pot onto the stovetop.
Add the diced onion.
steps.description: Cook until translucent, for 1 to 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the spices to the cooked onion.
steps.description: This means adding the minced garlic, minced ginger and the smoked paprika, curry powder and cayenne pepper. Also add in the thyme leaves, stripped from the stem. Stir all of it together for a minute, still on the medium heat.

steps.headline: Add the tomatoes, diced bell peppers, sliced cabbage and thin carrot slices (or grated carrot) to the cooked onions and spices.
steps.description: Stir to combine. Allow to cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently to stop the ingredients sticking to the saucepan. If needed, add a tablespoon of water, but avoid adding too much.

steps.headline: Tip the baked beans into the cooked vegetable mixture.
steps.description: Add the vegetable stock powder and mix through well. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add seasonings, as desired.
steps.description: You could add freshly cracked pepper and salt, but taste first to see how it is before adding anything else.

steps.headline: Transfer the chakalaka to 3 to 4 serving bowls or plates.
steps.description: Serve with crusty bread or pap.

steps.description: Transfer to 4 to 6 bowls or plates. Serve with pap, crusty bread or couscous, polenta or rice.

Once it boils, reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the baked beans. Stir to mix in. Taste test before adding salt and pepper to season the dish. Remove from the heat.
